org.opends.server.replication.server

Class MessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.api.MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
      • org.opends.server.replication.server.MessageHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServerHandler

    public class MessageHandler
extends MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
    This class implements a buffering/producer/consumer mechanism of replication changes (UpdateMsg) used inside the replication server. MessageHandlers are registered into Replication server domains. When an update message is received by a domain, the domain forwards the message to the registered message handlers. Message are buffered into a queue. Consumers are expected to come and consume the UpdateMsg from the queue.

      Specifies whether the consumer is following the producer (is not late).

      Specifies the max queue size for this handler.
      protected int outCount
      Number of update sent to the server.
      protected ReplicationServer replicationServer
      Local hosting RS.
      protected ReplicationServerDomain replicationServerDomain
      Specifies the related replication server domain based on serviceId(baseDn).
      protected int replicationServerId
      The serverID of the hosting replication server.
      protected java.lang.String replicationServerURL
      The URL of the hosting replication server.
      protected static DebugTracer TRACER
      The tracer object for the debug logger.

        replicationServerURL - The URL of the hosting replication server.
        replicationServerId - The ID of the hosting replication server.

      • getNextMessage

        protected UpdateMsg getNextMessage(boolean synchronous)
        Get the next update that must be sent to the consumer from the message queue or from the database.
        Parameters:
        synchronous - specifies what to do when the queue is empty. when true, the method blocks; when false the method return null.
        Returns:
        The next update that must be sent to the consumer. null when synchronous is false and queue is empty.

      • setConsumerActive

        public void setConsumerActive(boolean active)
